parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
Now, just now, at this moment. Adverb from a derivative of airo through the idea of suspension; just now.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: It becomes, is fitting to, is right. Apparently a primary verb; to tower up, i.e. to be suitable or proper.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
